publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

abstract.p: This paper extends previous work in the area of commercial paper rating models using data for the years 1985 and 1986 and the ratings of commercial paper by Standard & Poor's and Moody's. MDA, LOGIT, and CART are the three statistical tests used. The models had a prediction rate about 85 percent. It was found that in some rating categories, the quality component (judgment by analysts) played a greater role than in other categories. Variables such as sales, earning power, return on assets, and amount of equity were identified as most important in explaining ratings of commercial paper.
